aiQuery.Describe what you want to query in natur: Describe what you want to query in natural language:
aiQuery.Example: Show me the total number of use: Example: Show me the total number of users registered in the last 30 days
aiQuery.Please enter a description of what you w: Please enter a description of what you want to query

projectDashboard.Schedule data updates for this dashboard: Schedule data updates for this dashboard
projectDashboard.Let's create a chart to get started: Let's create a chart to get started
projectDashboard.Are you sure you want to delete the dash: Are you sure you want to delete the dashboard?
projectDashboard.Delete warning: Deleting a dashboard will delete all the charts and make the report unavailable. This action cannot be undone.

integrations.Create integrations description: Create new integrations that you can use across your team's projects. Currently, the integrations are mainly used for chart alerts and notifications.

teamMembers.Remove member warning: This action cannot be undone. The user will lose access to all projects in this team.
teamMembers.Something went wrong: Something went wrong. Please try again
teamMembers.Server error: Oh no! There's a server issue. Please try again
teamMembers.Server error with emoji: Oh no! There's a server issue ðŸ™ˆ Please try again
teamMembers.Are you sure to remove: Are you sure you want to remove the user from the team?
teamMembers.Remove user warning: This action will remove the user from the team and restrict them from accessing the dashboards.
teamMembers.Project access description: Tick the projects you want to give the user access to. The unticked projects cannot be accessed by this user.
teamMembers.Data export tooltip: The data export can contain sensitive information from your queries that is not necessarily visible on your charts. Only allow the data export when you intend for the users to view this data.
teamMembers.Client admin description: Can create, edit, and remove charts in assigned dashboards. The admins can also edit the tagged dataset configurations, including the query.
teamMembers.Client editor description: Can create, edit, and remove charts in assigned dashboards. The editors can also edit the tagged dataset configurations, but cannot edit the query.

connectionList.Are you sure to delete: Are you sure you want to delete this connection?
connectionList.Delete warning: Just a heads-up that all the datasets and charts that use this connection will stop working. This action cannot be undone.
connectionList.Tags info: Use tags to grant dashboard members access to these connections. Tagged connections can be used by members to create their own datasets within the associated dashboards.

connectionWizard.Engineering help: Someone from your engineering team can help you with this.
connectionWizard.Ask to join: Ask them to join your team with this link
connectionWizard.Tutorials description: We have a number of tutorials that can help you get started with Chartbrew and learn more about the platform.

mysqlConnectionForm.File too large: File size is too large. Max size is 8KB
mysqlConnectionForm.Enter name: Please enter a name which is less than 24 characters
mysqlConnectionForm.Enter host: Please enter a host name or IP address for your database
mysqlConnectionForm.Enter connection string: Please enter a connection string first
mysqlConnectionForm.Name placeholder: Enter a name that you can recognise later
mysqlConnectionForm.Certificate formats: Certificates are accepted in .crt, .pem, and .key formats
